Class Client

extends java.lang.Object

      Client​(java.lang.String host, int port, GameModel gameModel, java.io.PrintStream outStream)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client​(java.lang.String host,
              int port,
              GameModel gameModel,
              java.io.PrintStream outStream)
        Constructs a new game client with specified host, port, game model, and output stream.
        Parameters:
        host - The server's hostname or IP address.
        port - The port on which the server is listening.
        gameModel - The model representing the game state.
        outStream - The output stream for client messages.

    • Method Detail

      • setDimension

        public void setDimension​(int selectedDimension)
        Sets the dimension of the game grid.
        Parameters:
        selectedDimension - The selected dimension.

      • startConnection

        public void startConnection()
        Starts a connection to the game server.

      • sendMessage

        public java.lang.String sendMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a message to the server and receives a response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be sent to the server.
        Returns:
        The response received from the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's an error in network communication.

      • stopConnection

        public void stopConnection()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the connection to the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's an error in network communication.

      • sendGameConfiguration

        public void sendGameConfiguration()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the current game configuration to the server. The game configuration is retrieved from the game model and is then transmitted to the server using the appropriate protocol.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's an error in network communication.

      • requestGameConfiguration

        public void requestGameConfiguration()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Requests a game configuration from the server. The received configuration is then printed to the output stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's an error in network communication.

      • sendGameResults

        public void sendGameResults​(java.lang.String playerName,
                            int points)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the game results for a player to the server. The results include the player's name and the points they've scored.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player.
        points - The points scored by the player.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's an error in network communication.
